questions.question_text: Which of the following is a true statement about the TOGAF Technical Reference Model?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
43.1.2 TRM Components
Any TRM has two main components:
1. A taxonomy, which defines terminology, and provides a coherent description of the components and conceptual structure of an information system
2. An associated TRM graphic, which provides a visual representation of the taxonomy, as an aid to understanding
The objective of the TOGAF TRM is to provide a widely accepted core taxonomy, and an appropriate visual representation of that taxonomy. The TRM graphic is illustrated in 43.3 TRM in Detail, and the taxonomy is


https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap43.html#tag_43_03

Selected Answer: D
graphical models and a corresponding tax-onomy

Correct Answer 

Other options seems wrong
Link TOGAF9.1 : https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap43.html

choices.B: The Technical Reference Model is an integral part of the TOGAF Architecture Development Method
choices.E: The Technical Reference Model provides a direct mapping to the Zachman Framework
choices.D: The Technical Reference Model includes a set of graphical models and a corresponding tax-onomy
choices.A: The TOGAF Architecture Development Method mandates the use of the Technical Reference Model for large complex architecture projects
choices.C: The Technical Reference Model should not be modified

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. The Integrated Information Infrastructure Reference Model (III-RM) is an example of a (n) ______ Architecture reference model

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The High-Level III-RM Graphic
The resulting Integrated Information Infrastructure Reference Model itself is depicted in Figure 3. It is fundamentally an Application Architecture reference model

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. According to TOGAF, the simplest way of thinking about the Enterprise Continuum is as a _____

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
41.1 Overview

The Architecture Capability defines the parameters, structures, and processes that support governance of the Architecture Repository.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap41.html

questions.question_text: What class of architectural information within the Architecture Repository defines processes that support governance of the Architecture Repository?
Which one of the following is the most generic artifact in the Architecture Continuum?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
39.1 Overview
The Enterprise Continuum provides methods for classifying architecture and solution artifacts, both internal and external to the Architecture Repository, as they evolve from generic Foundation Architectures to Organization-Specific Architectures.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap39.html

Correct Answer 


Architecture Continuum
A part of the Enterprise Continuum. A repository of architectural elements with increasing detail and specialization.
Note:
This Continuum begins with foundational definitions like reference models, core strategies, and basic building blocks. From there it spans to Industry Architectures and all the way to an Organization-Specific Architecture.
